title: Chennai, Expect 'Critical' Rain To Bring Relief From Heat As IMD Issues Orange Alert For Very Heavy Rain
text: Trending: Chennai, Expect 'Critical' Rain To Bring Relief From Heat As IMD Issues Orange Alert For Very Heavy Rain Chennai is preparing for substantial rainfall as the northeast monsoon nears, prompting an orange alert from the IMD for heavy rain on October 15 and 16. With current heavy rains impacting the city and forecasts predicting continued storms, residents are advised to stay vigilant. (Image- IMD Website) KEY HIGHLIGHTS - Chennai is bracing for significant rainfall as the northeast monsoon approaches, with an orange alert issued for October 15 and 16. - Heavy rains have already begun in various areas of the city, including Royapettah and Chepauk, with further thunderstorms expected today. - The weather forecast indicates light to moderate rain will continue throughout the week, with temperatures ranging between 30 and 33 degrees Celsius. Chennai: As the northeast monsoon (NEM) approaches, Chennai is preparing for significant rainfall, according to the popular forecaster on X, ‘Chennai Rains.’ The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an orange alert for heavy to very heavy rainfall on October 15 and 16, indicating that disruptive weather is anticipated in the city. Tamil Nadu has already begun experiencing heavy rains in various towns since last week. The Chennai Meteorological Centre has issued warnings for heavy and very heavy rainfall across the state. Chennai Rains Today In Chennai, heavy rains have been reported since early morning today in areas such as Royapettah, Thiruvalluvar Nagar, Chepauk, Anna Salai, Manali, Madhavaram, and Puzhal. The forecast indicates that light to moderate rainfall, accompanied by thunder and lightning, is likely in many places across Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and Karaikal today, October 12. For Chennai, today’s weather prediction includes the possibility of moderate rain with thunder and lightning in some parts of the city. The maximum temperature is expected to range between 32-33 degrees Celsius, while the minimum temperature will hover around 25-26 degrees Celsius. Looking ahead, on October 13, light to moderate rain, along with thunder and lightning, is expected in many areas of Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and Karaikal. The hill regions in Tiruppur and Coimbatore, as well as Nilgiris, Dindigul, Erode, and Karur districts, could see heavy rainfall at a few locations. Chennai Weekly Weather Forecast The weather forecast for Chennai over the next few days indicates a mix of partly cloudy skies and thunderstorms. On October 12, temperatures are expected to range from 32 to 33 degrees Celsius during the day, with a minimum of 25 to 26 degrees at night. Moderate rain, accompanied by thunderstorms and lightning, is likely in some areas. This pattern continues on October 13, with similar temperatures and conditions. On October 14, temperatures are projected to be between 31 and 32 degrees, with the potential for moderate to heavy rain, along with thunderstorms. The following day, October 15, will see a slight dip in temperatures to around 30 to 31 degrees, but the chance of thunderstorms and moderate to heavy rain remains. As we move into October 16, the forecast suggests temperatures around 32 degrees, with light to moderate rain expected. The week will conclude on October 17 with similar conditions, maintaining the possibility of light to moderate rain and thunderstorms.
